articles.description: After four seasons at Northwestern, quarterback Hunter Johnson is transferring back to Clemson -- a rare transfer to Dabo Swinney's program.
articles.headline: Onetime Clemson football recruit QB Hunter Johnson transfers back to Tigers after career at Northwestern

article.description: Reggie Diggs hauled in a 36-yard touchdown pass from Kyle Lauletta midway through the fourth quarter to help Richmond get past Hampton 31-28 on Saturday.
article.headline: Richmond gets by Hampton 31-28
article.story: HAMPTON, Va. -- Reggie Diggs hauled in a 36-yard touchdown pass from Kyle Lauletta midway through the fourth quarter to help Richmond get past Hampton 31-28 on Saturday. Diggs' score came four minutes after Seth Fisher's 12-yard touchdown run, which brought Richmond back from a 28-16 deficit after the third quarter. Lauletta was 20 of 32 for 247 yards and two touchdown passes. Hampton built a 21-7 halftime lead on two touchdown passes from David Watford -- to Twarn Mixson and Shakim Alonzo -- and Mixson threw for a score. Mixson threw a 15-yard pass to Rashawn Proctor that started the scoring not two minutes into the game after Breon Key picked off Lauletta and returned it to the Richmond 15. Watford finished 17 of 33 for 239 yards and three touchdowns. Richmond (1-1) is 22-1 in non-conference FCS games since 2005. Hampton (1-1) is 0-3 against their in-state rival and 2-14 all-time against Colonial Athletic Conference opponents. ----- AP College Football website: www.collegefootball.ap.org

scoringPlays.text: Rashawn Proctor 15 Yd pass from Twarn Mixson (Adam Brown Kick)
Twarn Mixson 15 Yd pass from David Watford (Adam Brown Kick)

Porter Abell 16 Yd pass from Kyle Lauletta (Two-Point Pass Conversion Failed)
Rashawn Proctor 30 Yd pass from David Watford (Adam Brown Kick)
Seth Fisher 12 Yd Run (Peter Yoder Kick)
Reggie Diggs 36 Yd pass from Kyle Lauletta (Jacobi Green Run for Two-Point Conversion)
